title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: The name of Webster's Close, on the same side of the Street, by which Brown's Court was formerly known, served to indicate the site of Dr Webster's house, the originator of the Widow's Scheme, and long one of the ministers of the Old Tolbooth Kirk. He was a person of great influence and popularity in his day, and entertained Dr Johnson often at his table during his visit to Edinburgh.
